docs.lead_paragraph: As they tackle numerous financial issues, some baby boomers considering retirement are hiring life counselors to help them plot their futures.

headline.main: Taking a Job Out of the Financial Equation
headline.print_headline: Taking a Job Out of the Financial Equation

docs.abstract: Many baby boomers considering retirement are hiring life counselors to help them plan their futures and numerous financial challenges ahead of them; experts say most of the generation about to enter retirement have no clue how to plan for it, but increasing numbers are seeking out financial planners to help them navigate.
docs.snippet: As they tackle numerous financial issues, some baby boomers considering retirement are hiring life counselors to help them plot their futures.

docs.lead_paragraph: The topics in the Clinton administration documents include the conflicts in Somalia and Rwanda, Middle East peace talks, the Oklahoma City bombing and the attempt to overhaul the health care system.

headline.main: New Batch of Clinton Documents Is Released
headline.print_headline: Documents Highlight Hillary Clinton’s Role in 1993 Health Care Effort

docs.abstract: National Archives releases its largest batch yet of previously withheld documents from the Clinton administration, covering wide range of topics; bundle that is likely to receive the most attention is one that covers Hillary Rodham Clinton’s ill-fated attempt as first lady to overhaul national health care system; other notable sections highlighted.
docs.snippet: The topics in the Clinton administration documents include the conflicts in Somalia and Rwanda, Middle East peace talks, the Oklahoma City bombing and the attempt to overhaul the health care system.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker, Carl Hulse and Jason Horowitz contributed reporting. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. bankruptcy judge largely declined on Friday to rule that former American Airlines parent company AMR Corp had a unilateral right to terminate benefits for nearly 47,000 retirees.

headline.main: AMR Loses Bid to Terminate Retiree Benefits
headline.print_headline: AMR Loses Bid to Terminate Retiree Benefits

docs.snippet: A U.S. bankruptcy judge largely declined on Friday to rule that former American Airlines parent company AMR Corp had a unilateral right to terminate benefits for nearly 47,000 retirees.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has rejected an attempt by American Airlines to quickly cut off benefits for many of its retirees.

headline.main: Judge Says American Can't End Retiree Benefits Yet
headline.print_headline: Judge Says American Can't End Retiree Benefits Yet

docs.snippet: A federal judge has rejected an attempt by American Airlines to quickly cut off benefits for many of its retirees.

docs.lead_paragraph: For the more than 30 states that defaulted to the federal government under President Barack Obama's health care law, time may be running out to decide whether to create their own state-run insurance exchanges.

headline.main: Clock Ticking for States to Adopt Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Clock Ticking for States to Adopt Health Exchanges

docs.snippet: For the more than 30 states that defaulted to the federal government under President Barack Obama's health care law, time may be running out to decide whether to create their own state-run insurance exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: Biogen Idec Inc is pricing its newly approved long-acting hemophilia drug, Alprolix, to cost U.S. patients, and insurers, about the same per year as older, less convenient therapies whose price can reach about $300,000 annually.

headline.main: Exclusive: Biogen Prices Hemophilia Drug on Par With Older Therapies
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Biogen Prices Hemophilia Drug on Par With Older Therapies

docs.snippet: Biogen Idec Inc is pricing its newly approved long-acting hemophilia drug, Alprolix, to cost U.S. patients, and insurers, about the same per year as older, less convenient therapies whose price can reach about $300,000 annually.

docs.lead_paragraph: Departing U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is not considering running for the U.S. Senate, a spokeswoman said Friday.

headline.print_headline: Spokeswoman: Sebelius Not Considering US Senate

docs.snippet: Departing U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is not considering running for the U.S. Senate, a spokeswoman said Friday.

headline.main: On the Liberal Bias of Facts

docs.abstract: Still true after all these years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of pages of documents from President Bill Clinton's White House affirm a longtime adage: The more things change, the more they stay the same.

headline.main: From Clinton to Obama, Many Parallels
headline.print_headline: From Clinton to Obama, Many Parallels

docs.snippet: Thousands of pages of documents from President Bill Clinton's White House affirm a longtime adage: The more things change, the more they stay the same.

docs.lead_paragraph: The outlook for President Barack Obama's health care law is getting better, with more people enrolled overall and a much-needed surge of interest among young adults.

headline.main: Late Sign-Ups Improve Outlook for Obama Health Law
headline.print_headline: Late Sign-Ups Improve Outlook for Obama Health Law

docs.snippet: The outlook for President Barack Obama's health care law is getting better, with more people enrolled overall and a much-needed surge of interest among young adults.
